VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Enable Cart Scale

To begin using Cart Scale, update your storefront configuration settings, including the asynchronous processing threshold, which determines when processing switches from synchronous to asynchronous.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) only



USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
Verify that your storefront specifies one of the following cart reprice strategies:
Daily
Expired
Daily or Expired
NOTE Cart Scale evaluates your selected reprice strategy and ensures that the cart's price data is current before the buyer can continue to check out. However, a reprice strategy of Always prevents Cart Scale's synchronous portion of checkout from proceeding. Avoid using the Always strategy when you enable Cart Scale. For more information about reprice strategies, see Optimize How Frequently the Shopping Cart Page Calls Price Logic.
Update the required storefront configuration settings.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Cart Scale (3).
Find the Enable Cart Scale configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart Scale
Configuration	Enable Cart Scale
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Find the Asynchronous Processing Threshold configuration (6), and find its value (7).
TIP
The default value, 250, specifies that processing automatically switches from synchronous to asynchronous when the cart contains 250 or more major line items. For more information about tradeoffs to consider for asynchronous processing, see Considerations for Asynchronous Processing for Carts and Orders.
To force synchronous processing for all cart pricing and order placement jobs, specify a threshold value of 0.
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Cart Scale
Configuration	Asynchronous Processing Threshold
Page	all
Value	An integer
Update the template for the Shopping Cart page to use a two-column page layout. Complete the steps in Modify the Column Layout of a Storefront Page using the following values:
Find the Name configuration where Page is Cart.
In the Value column, replace cc_tmpl_OneColRD with cc_tmpl_TwoColAltRD.
NOTE By default, the Scaled Cart page inherits the cc_tmpl_OneColRD template, which specifies a one-column page layout used with the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0. When you enable Cart Scale, the Scaled Cart page replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0. For the best buyer experience with the Scaled Cart page, we recommend that you use cc_tmpl_TwoColAltRD or another two-column layout.
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

After you enable Cart Scale, the following buyer experience enhancements are available:

The Scaled Cart page, which replaces the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0 with buyer experience enhancements for managing a cart that contains a large number of items:
Pagination controls for a more manageable view of all the cart's items.
Options for a buyer to sort and search the cart's items.
Tools for refreshing the price and availability data for the cart's items, which is required before the buyer can check out.
Tools for removing products that become unavailable after a refresh.
Asynchronous processing for pricing items in the cart, including messages and statuses on the Scaled Cart page.
Asynchronous processing for placing an order, including messages, statuses, and new order result email templates.
An option on the My Orders section of the My Account page, Restore Cart, which reopens and reactivates a cart that corresponds to an order that failed to place asynchronously.
Updated sections of the standard Checkout page for reviewing and confirming an order that contains a large number of cart items and that was placed asynchronously.
